item.title: Mary add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "People say that what we’re all seeking is a meaning for life. I don’t think that’s what we’re really seeking. I think that what we’re seeking is an experience of being alive, so that our life experiences on the purely physical plane will have resonances with our own innermost being and reality, so that we actually feel the rapture of being alive." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life is like arriving late for a movie, having to figure out what was going on without bothering everybody with a lot of questions, and then being unexpectedly called away before you find out how it ends." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I don't know much about being a millionaire, but I'll bet I'd be darling at it." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "What fresh hell is this?" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I'm never going to accomplish anything; that's perfectly clear to me. I'm never going to be famous. My name will never be writ large on the roster of Those Who Do Things. I don't do anything. Not one single thing. I used to bite my nails, but I don't even do that any more." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Take me or leave me; or, as is the usual order of things, both." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "By the time you swear you're his, Shivering and sighing. And he vows his passion is, Infinite, undying. Lady make note of this -- One of you is lying." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "So, you're the man who can't spell 'fuck.'" Dorothy Parker to Norman Mailer after publishers had convinced Mailer to replace the word with a euphemism, 'fug,' in his 1948 book, "The Naked and the Dead." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The first thing I do in the morning is brush my teeth and sharpen my tongue." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Drink and dance and laugh and lie, Love, the reeling midnight through, For tomorrow we shall die! (But, alas, we never do.)" -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mary add a quote by Tori Amos
item.description: "I don't see myself as weird, I just see myself as honest." -- Tori Amos

item.title: Mary add a quote by tori amos
item.description: "I see the dream and I see the nightmare, and I believe you can't have the dream without the nightmare" -- tori amos

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde
